org.opentcs.algorithms

Interface ResourceUser


  • public interface ResourceUser
    Defines callback methods for clients of the resource scheduler.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void allocationFailed(java.util.Set<TCSResource> resources)
      Called if it was impossible to allocate resources for this ResourceUser.
      boolean allocationSuccessful(java.util.Set<TCSResource> resources)
      Called when resources have been reserved for this ResourceUser.
      java.lang.String getId()
      Returns an ID string for this ResourceUser.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
        Returns an ID string for this ResourceUser. The returned string should be unique among all ResourceUsers in the system. This method may never return null.
        Returns:
        An ID string for this ResourceUser.

      • allocationSuccessful

        boolean allocationSuccessful(java.util.Set<TCSResource> resources)
        Called when resources have been reserved for this ResourceUser.
        Parameters:
        resources - The resources reserved.
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, this ResourceUser accepts the resources allocated. A return value of false indicates this ResourceUser does not need the given resources (any more), freeing them implicitly.

      • allocationFailed

        void allocationFailed(java.util.Set<TCSResource> resources)
        Called if it was impossible to allocate resources for this ResourceUser.
        Parameters:
        resources - The resources which could not be reserved.
